body:
@ianlancetaylor Yes. I wrote the code above as an example, but did a bad job of making it clear. I originally encountered the issue in [this code](https://github.com/obeattie/sase/tree/go-9702) (you need to checkout that specific branch if you want to see for yourself).

To @minux's point, yes, running `go install github.com/obeattie/sase/domain` first does fix this. Is this, in fact, expected behaviour?
